item.title: Evaluation Team: Expert II – Evaluation Expert (Cat II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Evaluation

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effects links between inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholders and the wider public with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Agriculture for Development programme, paying particular attention to its results measured against its objectives;

  • key lessons and recommendations in order to improve current (BAFS) and future Actions. It should not only describe what has been achieved or what the Action contributed to achieve but particularly why and upon what conditions results have been achieved or not.

Requested Services

The evaluation will assess the Action using the five standard DAC evaluation criteria, namely: relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, sustainability and impact. In addition, the evaluation will assess two EU specific evaluation criteria:

  • the EU added value (the extent to which the Action adds benefits to what would have resulted from Member States' interventions only);

  • the coherence of the Action itself, with the EU strategy in Sierra Leone and with other EU policies and Member State Actions, and the agricultural programmes of the World Bank in Sierra Leone.

The evaluation team shall furthermore consider whether the following cross-cutting issues: gender equality, environmental sustainability and fostering of the private sector, were taken into account in the identification/formulation documents and the extent to which they have been reflected in the implementation of the Action and its monitoring.

The evaluation process will be carried out in three phases: An Inception Phase, a Field Phase, and a Synthesis Phase. Deliverables in the form of reports should be submitted at the end of the corresponding phases.

Experience and Qualifications required

Minimum requirements of the team:

  • At least one member of the team has sizeable experience in evaluation of agricultural policies and programmes/projects;

  • At least one member of the team: 7 years of experience in agricultural policies and governance, strategic planning, project design and institutional capacity building;

  • At least one member of the team: 3 years field experience in agricultural projects in West Africa, familiarity with Sierra Leone will be an asset;

  • At least one member of the team: knowledge and experience of the project cycle management of EU funded development aid modalities;

  • At least one team member: excellent oral and verbal communication skills in English;

Language skills of the team:

  • English

  • At least one team member: familiarity with one or more local languages is considered an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3957

item.description:
Description of Project:

Evaluation

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. item.title: Expert 3 – Cat III
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Global objective

The global objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to enhance scientific literacy of the students at all levels of education in the Turkish Cypriot community via providing opportunity for laboratory experiences and to prepare them as the next generation of scientists, engineers and innovators with skills for enhanced employability and capacity for innovation.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives are:

  • To provide a comprehensive assessment of the science and/or specialised laboratory infrastructure of around 200 pre-primary, primary, secondary education and vocational education and training schools;

  • To identify the types of labs required for different levels of education and to categorise the schools under different lab types in order to be able to identify the necessary equipment, materials, software needs for the establishment of science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs in the TCc; and

  • To make specific recommendations, in the form of a preparation of Technical Specifications or future EU support in the area of supplying science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs, based on the findings from the assessment.

  • To provide recommendations on necessary structures for ensuring sustainability and effective utilisation and maintenance of the laboratories.

Experience and Qualifications required

Technical Expert with at least 3 years of professional experience in the education sector.

Education (Minimum requirement)

  • A degree in relevant fields such as science, education, pedagogy, social sciences, etc.

  • or, in its absence, 2 years of equivalent professional experience beyond the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 3+2 = 5 years of professional experience in the education sector).

Professional Experience (Minimum requirement)

  • At least 3 years of professional experience in the education sector specifically in science teaching and learning (cumulative).

  • At least 2 years of professional experience in science laboratories and experiments.

  • At least 2 years of local experience in the education sector.

Recommended

  • Knowledge of education systems and policies of EU countries and ET2020.

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

  • Command of written and spoken Turkish is a strong advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3953

item.title: Expert 2 – Cat II
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project

Global objective

The global objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to enhance scientific literacy of the students at all levels of education in the Turkish Cypriot community via providing opportunity for laboratory experiences and to prepare them as the next generation of scientists, engineers and innovators with skills for enhanced employability and capacity for innovation.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives are:

  • To provide a comprehensive assessment of the science and/or specialised laboratory infrastructure of around 200 pre-primary, primary, secondary education and vocational education and training schools;

  • To identify the types of labs required for different levels of education and to categorise the schools under different lab types in order to be able to identify the necessary equipment, materials, software needs for the establishment of science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs in the TCc; and

  • To make specific recommendations, in the form of a preparation of Technical Specifications or future EU support in the area of supplying science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs, based on the findings from the assessment.

  • To provide recommendations on necessary structures for ensuring sustainability and effective utilisation and maintenance of the laboratories.

Experience and Qualifications required

Technical Expert with at least 6 years of professional experience in the education sector.

Education (Minimum requirement)

  • Master’s degree in relevant fields such as science, education, pedagogy, social sciences, etc.

  • or, in its absence, 2 years of equivalent professional experience beyond the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 6+2 = 8 years of professional experience in the education sector).

Professional Experience (Minimum requirement)

  • At least 6 years of professional experience in the education sector specifically in science teaching and learning (cumulative).

  • At least 2 years of professional experience in science laboratories and experiments.

  • In-depth knowledge of education systems and policies of EU countries and ET2020

Recommended:

  • Experience with EU funded projects and applicable procurement rules (following the PRAG).

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.
  • Command of written and spoken Turkish is a strong advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3953

item.title: Team Leader – Cat I
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of Project:

Global objective

The global objective of the programme, of which this contract is a part, is to enhance scientific literacy of the students at all levels of education in the Turkish Cypriot community via providing opportunity for laboratory experiences and to prepare them as the next generation of scientists, engineers and innovators with skills for enhanced employability and capacity for innovation.

Specific objective(s)

The specific objectives are:

  • To provide a comprehensive assessment of the science and/or specialised laboratory infrastructure of around 200 pre-primary, primary, secondary education and vocational education and training schools;

  • To identify the types of labs required for different levels of education and to categorise the schools under different lab types in order to be able to identify the necessary equipment, materials, software needs for the establishment of science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs in the TCc; and

  • To make specific recommendations, in the form of a preparation of Technical Specifications or future EU support in the area of supplying science and/or specialised labs and/or mobile mini-labs, based on the findings from the assessment.

  • To provide recommendations on necessary structures for ensuring sustainability and effective utilisation and maintenance of the laboratories.

Experience and Qualifications required

  • Technical Expert with at least 12 years of professional experience in the education sector.

Education (Minimum requirement)

  • Master’s degree in relevant fields such as science, education, pedagogy, social sciences, etc.

  • or, in its absence, 4 years of equivalent professional experience beyond the general professional experience duration fixed below (i.e. 12+4 = 16 years of professional experience in the education sector).

Professional Experience (Minimum requirement)

  • At least 12 years of professional experience in the education sector specifically in science teaching and learning (cumulative).

  • At least 3 years of professional experience in science laboratories and experiments.

  • In-depth knowledge of education systems and policies of EU countries and ET2020

Recommended

  • At least 5 years of professional experience in designing technical assistance projects for the improvement of the education sector and the human-resource development sector.

  • Experience with EU funded projects and applicable procurement rules (following the PRAG).

Language skills

  • Excellent command of written and spoken English.

item.title: Two Senior Experts in Field of Law Enforcement
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term evaluation Euromed Police IV

Objectives of the evaluation Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission.

The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches and the contribution towards the implementation of the SDGs.

From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effect links between: inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, learning, and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, the interested stakeholders with:

  • an overall independent assessment of the past performance of the Euromed Police IV, paying particular attention to its intermediate results measured against its objectives;
  • key lessons and recommendations in order to improve current and future Actions.

In particular, this evaluation will serve to steer the ongoing programme and to prepare the next phase of this programme.

The main users of this evaluation will be DG NEAR B2 and indirectly DG HOME A3 and D1, DG DEVCO B5, EEAS MENA, Europol, Cepol and Interpol.

Requested services Scope of the evaluation

The evaluation will assess the Action using the five standard DAC evaluation criteria, namely: relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, sustainability and early signs of impact. In addition, the evaluation will assess two EU specific evaluation criteria:

  • the EU added value (the extent to which the Action adds benefits to what would have resulted from Member States' interventions only);
  • the coherence of the Action itself, with the EU strategy in the security sector and with other EU policies and Member State Actions.

The evaluation team shall furthermore consider whether gender, the relevant SDGs and their interlinkages were identified and the rights-based approach methodology was followed in the identification/formulation documents and the extent to which they have been reflected in the implementation of the Action, its governance and monitoring.

KE1 and KE2 (Cat.I)

Expertise required

Minimum requirements of the team

  • At least 5 years professional experience in the field of law enforcement, including fields such as organised crime, terrorism, cybercrime, trafficking of human beings, etc.

  • Extensive experience in the field of international cooperation, of which preferably 3 years with North Africa or Middle East.

  • Knowledge of the EU Policy cycle and the work of Europol, Cepol but also Interpol.

  • At least 3 years professional experience in project cycle management, in particular the logical framework approach.

  • Significant experience in evaluation of projects in the field of law enforcement in the last five years (three references to be given with the name of the relevant evaluation manager, directorate and unit).

  • None of the experts may have intervened as short-term expert in Euromed Police III or IV.

Language skills of the team:

  • English: at least 1 member shall possess a level B2 expertise;
  • French: at least 1 member shall possess a level B2 expertise;

item.title: Experto de Producción de informes de percepción público
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR)

Objetivos de la Evaluación

La evaluación sistemática y oportuna, de sus programas y actividades es una clara prioridad de la Comisión Europea . El objetivo de las evaluaciones es hacer un balance de los logros, de la calidad y de los resultados de las Acciones, en el contexto de una estrategia de cooperación en constante evolución que se basa cada vez más en enfoques orientados a los resultados . Desde esta perspectiva, las evaluaciones deben buscar pruebas de porqué, cuáles y cómo estos resultados están vinculados a la intervención de la UE e identificar los factores claves que motivan o dificultan los avances.

La evaluación deberá permitir la comprensión de la relación de causa-efecto entre las actividades, los efectos directos y los impactos. Las evaluaciones deberán tener como objetivos principales el contribuir a la rendición de cuentas, la toma de decisiones, el aprendizaje y la mejora de la gestión.

Los principales objetivos de esta evaluación son suministrar a los servicios competentes de la Unión Europea, las partes interesadas y el público en general:

  • Una valoración independiente de la ejecución Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR), centrándose en especial en sus resultados ‘intermedios’ en relación a sus objetivos;
  • las principales enseñanzas y recomendaciones con vistas a mejorar la Acción actuales (si aplicable) y futuras.

En particular, esta evaluación servirá para evaluar el impacto que el Programa ha tenido hasta la fecha y comprender mejor la percepción pública de dicho impacto.

Los principales usuarios de esta evaluación serán el gobierno, la sociedad civil, los pueblos indígenas, la industria maderera, los donantes y el público en general.

Experto de Producción de informes de percepción público

Educación del equipo: Al menos una licenciatura en nivel académico o experiencia equivalente profesional, en Economía o Administración o Sociología o Psicología o Estadística o Ingeniería o Aplicaciones Informáticas, o Ciencias Políticas.

Experiencia del equipo

  • Al menos 3 años de experiencia en producción de Informes de Percepción Pública.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3932

WE ARE ONLY ABLE TO RESPOND TO CANDIDATES WHO MEET THE SPECIFICATIONS

item.title: Experto de Producción de video
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR)

Objetivos de la Evaluación

La evaluación sistemática y oportuna, de sus programas y actividades es una clara prioridad de la Comisión Europea . El objetivo de las evaluaciones es hacer un balance de los logros, de la calidad y de los resultados de las Acciones, en el contexto de una estrategia de cooperación en constante evolución que se basa cada vez más en enfoques orientados a los resultados . Desde esta perspectiva, las evaluaciones deben buscar pruebas de porqué, cuáles y cómo estos resultados están vinculados a la intervención de la UE e identificar los factores claves que motivan o dificultan los avances.

La evaluación deberá permitir la comprensión de la relación de causa-efecto entre las actividades, los efectos directos y los impactos. Las evaluaciones deberán tener como objetivos principales el contribuir a la rendición de cuentas, la toma de decisiones, el aprendizaje y la mejora de la gestión.

Los principales objetivos de esta evaluación son suministrar a los servicios competentes de la Unión Europea, las partes interesadas y el público en general:

  • Una valoración independiente de la ejecución Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR), centrándose en especial en sus resultados ‘intermedios’ en relación a sus objetivos;
  • las principales enseñanzas y recomendaciones con vistas a mejorar la Acción actuales (si aplicable) y futuras.

En particular, esta evaluación servirá para evaluar el impacto que el Programa ha tenido hasta la fecha y comprender mejor la percepción pública de dicho impacto.

Los principales usuarios de esta evaluación serán el gobierno, la sociedad civil, los pueblos indígenas, la industria maderera, los donantes y el público en general.

Experto de Producción de video

Educación del equipo: Al menos una licenciatura en nivel académico o experiencia equivalente profesional, en Comunicación o Periodismo o relevante en producción del video.

Experiencia del equipo

  • Al menos 3 años de experiencia en producción de videos.

El experto 5 necesita conocimiento en ambos idiomas de español e inglés.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format.

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3931

item.title: Experto con experiencia local
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR)

Objetivos de la Evaluación La evaluación sistemática y oportuna, de sus programas y actividades es una clara prioridad de la Comisión Europea . El objetivo de las evaluaciones es hacer un balance de los logros, de la calidad y de los resultados de las Acciones, en el contexto de una estrategia de cooperación en constante evolución que se basa cada vez más en enfoques orientados a los resultados . Desde esta perspectiva, las evaluaciones deben buscar pruebas de porqué, cuáles y cómo estos resultados están vinculados a la intervención de la UE e identificar los factores claves que motivan o dificultan los avances.

La evaluación deberá permitir la comprensión de la relación de causa-efecto entre las actividades, los efectos directos y los impactos. Las evaluaciones deberán tener como objetivos principales el contribuir a la rendición de cuentas, la toma de decisiones, el aprendizaje y la mejora de la gestión.

Los principales objetivos de esta evaluación son suministrar a los servicios competentes de la Unión Europea, las partes interesadas y el público en general:

  • Una valoración independiente de la ejecución Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR), centrándose en especial en sus resultados ‘intermedios’ en relación a sus objetivos;
  • las principales enseñanzas y recomendaciones con vistas a mejorar la Acción actuales (si aplicable) y futuras.

En particular, esta evaluación servirá para evaluar el impacto que el Programa ha tenido hasta la fecha y comprender mejor la percepción pública de dicho impacto.

Los principales usuarios de esta evaluación serán el gobierno, la sociedad civil, los pueblos indígenas, la industria maderera, los donantes y el público en general.

Experto con experiencia local

Educación del equipo: Al menos una licenciatura en nivel académico o experiencia equivalente profesional, en disciplinas relativas en Administración Publica, Economía, Medio Ambiente o Forestal o Desarrollo o Agronomía o Biología o Ecología o Cambio Climático.

Experiencia del equipo

  • Al menos 3 años de experiencia en relación del tema de Lot 1
  • Al menos 3 años de experiencia en países en vías de desarrollo en América Latina.
  • Preferiblemente, un mínimo de 1 año de experiencia en gestión de proyectos de apoyo presupuestario.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

item.title: Experto con experiencia evaluación de proyectos
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR)

Objetivos de la Evaluación

La evaluación sistemática y oportuna, de sus programas y actividades es una clara prioridad de la Comisión Europea . El objetivo de las evaluaciones es hacer un balance de los logros, de la calidad y de los resultados de las Acciones, en el contexto de una estrategia de cooperación en constante evolución que se basa cada vez más en enfoques orientados a los resultados . La evaluación deberá permitir la comprensión de la relación de causa-efecto entre las actividades, los efectos directos y los impactos.   • las principales enseñanzas y recomendaciones con vistas a mejorar la Acción actuales (si aplicable) y futuras.

Experto con experiencia evaluación de proyectos

Educación del equipo: Al menos un máster en nivel académico o experiencia equivalente profesional, en relevantes disciplinas relativas en Administración Publica o Medio Ambiente o Forestal o Desarrollo o Agronomía o Biología o Ecología o Cambio Climático.

Experiencia del equipo

  • Al menos 12 años de experiencia en relación del tema de Lot 1.
  • Al menos 10 años de experiencia relacionados con programas de cooperación de apoyo al medio ambiente, cambio climático, y bosques.
  • Al menos 5 años de experiencia en países en vías de desarrollo en América Latina.
  • Preferiblemente, un mínimo de 5 años de experiencia en gestión, seguimiento y evaluación de proyectos con monto superior a 5.000.000 Euros.

item.title: Líder, Programa de apoyo presupuestario al sector forestal de Honduras (PAPSFOR)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:

Los principales usuarios de esta evaluación serán el gobierno, la sociedad civil, los pueblos indígenas, la industria maderera, los donantes y el público en general.

Líder

Educación del equipo: Al menos un máster en nivel académico o experiencia equivalente profesional, en relevantes disciplinas relativas en Administración Publica o Economía o Medio Ambiente o Forestal o Desarrollo o Agronomía o Biología o Ecología o Cambio Climático, o Sociología o Psicología o Ingeniería o Ciencias Políticas.

Experiencia del equipo

  • Al menos 12 años de experiencia en relación del tema de Lot 1.
  • Al menos 10 años de experiencia relacionados con programas de cooperación de apoyo al medio ambiente, cambio climático, y bosques.
  • Al menos 5 años de experiencia en países en vías de desarrollo en América Latina.
  • Preferiblemente, un mínimo de 5 años de experiencia en gestión, seguimiento y evaluación de proyectos con monto superior a 5.000.000 Euros.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3927

item.title: Vehicle Load Control / Output Performance Road Contracts Expert (VLC / OPRC) (Cat I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study to design support for the governance in Sierra Leone’s transport sector

Global objective

The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is as follows:

Improved sustainability and security of the regional road transport system through a program to be designed by this assignment in order to obtain the results as described in the 11th EDF RIP regional financing agreement (FA) Nr. ROC/FED/23-219 dedicated to Sierra Leone.

Specific objective(s)
In the regional financing agreement (FA) Nr. ROC/FED/23-219, are foreseen actions and results related to support governance in Sierra Leone’s transport sector that cannot be implemented in a straight forward manner since the present State of Affairs (SoA) in this sector is not well known.

Hence, the purposes of this assignment are as follows:

  • Assess/Analyse/Review/Revisit the SoA in the governance of the transport sector and establish findings and recommendations;
  • Design a program to address the findings/recommendations, from bullet point one (just above) and also take into consideration recommendations from the report of May 2018 ofthe independent expert on the institutionalisation of an Axle Load Control System in Sierra Leone;
  • Prepare the full documentation of the tender dossier to procure a service contract to implement actions geared towards achieving the results foreseen in the financial agreement 39218.

All experts must be independent and free from conflicts of interest in the responsibilities they take on.

Expert 2 - Vehicle Load Control / Output Performance Road Contracts Expert (VLC / OPRC) (Cat I)

Qualifications and skills Minimum requirements

  • Education at least up to a Master Degree level, or equivalent professional experience of 12 years in one of the following fields: Vehicle Load Management, Civil Engineering;
  • Strong management skills;
  • Sound interpretational and communications skills;
  • Excellent presentation skills;
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken).

General professional experience Minimum requirements

  • At least 12 years of relevant professional experience, related to road maintenance, road maintenance planning and road maintenance funding;
  • Working experience in organization development.

Specific professional experience Minimum requirements

  • At least 12 years of relevant professional experience, related to road maintenance, road maintenance planning and road maintenance funding;
  • Proven experience in managing of/advising to an Output Performance Road Contract/Performance Based Road Contracting in the last 8 years (at least 1 project)
  • Proven experience in project management and public procurement training in the last 8 years (at least 1 project)
  • Excellent knowledge of vehicle load management;
  • Working experience and knowledge of the transport sector in West Africa will be considered as an asset.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3934

item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Study to design support for the governance in Sierra Leone’s transport sector

Global objective

The overall objective of the project of which this contract will be a part is as follows:

Improved sustainability and security of the regional road transport system through a program to be designed by this assignment in order to obtain the results as described in the 11th EDF RIP regional financing agreement (FA) Nr. ROC/FED/23-219 dedicated to Sierra Leone.

Specific objective(s)

In the regional financing agreement (FA) Nr. ROC/FED/23-219, are foreseen actions and results related to support governance in Sierra Leone’s transport sector that cannot be implemented in a straight forward manner since the present State of Affairs (SoA) in this sector is not well known.

  • Assess/Analyse/Review/Revisit the SoA in the governance of the transport sector and establish findings and recommendations;

All experts must be independent and free from conflicts of interest in the responsibilities they take on.

Team Leader/Transport and Logistics Specialist (Cat I)

Qualifications and skills Minimum requirements

  • Education at least up to a Master Degree level, or equivalent professional experience of 13 years in one of the following fields: transport logistics, transport/distribution management/ transport planning, transport economics, or other relevant discipline;
  • Strong management skills;
  • Sound interpretational and communications skills;
  • Excellent presentation skills;
  • Excellent skills and experience in drafting papers/proposals, reports, training material and guidelines, proven by a list of publication and reports;
  • Fluency in English (written and spoken).

General professional experience Minimum requirements

  • At least 12 years of relevant professional experience, related to multi-party project implementation, policy and strategy formulation, public administration management;
  • A minimum of 5 years (of the 12 years) on management/team leader level;

Specific professional experience Minimum requirements

  • Excellent knowledge of regional and interregional transport policies, strategies, transport sector implementation programmes and transport economics and cost calculations;
  • Expertise to facilitate the identification of short/long-term experts and manage an international team with the ability to coordinate the process of documentation of lessons learnt and reporting on progress made.
  • Experience in management, as TL, of at least 2 donor-funded (international institutions) technical assistance programmes;
  • Working experience and knowledge of the transport sector in West Africa will be considered as an asset.

item.title: Expert in Management of Health Information System
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Assessment of availability, appropriateness and quality of data from the Belize Health Information System (BHIS), design of actions to upgrade and expand the system and elaboration of complete tender dossiers

Global objective To assist the Government of Belize and the European Union in implementing the second specific objective of the Health Support Programme Belize: “Strengthen the Health information system in collaboration with an organized surveillance system”.

Specific objective(s) Elaborate complete European Union standard tender dossiers for the services and supplies required for upgrading and expanding the Belize Health Information System (BHIS), training for surveillance and data system, and development of a Cancer Registry.

In close collaboration with the BHIS technical unit in the Ministry of Health (MoH), the Epidemiology Unit and the National Authorising Office (NAO), relevant health facilities, IT providers, regional and district surveillance teams and other stakeholders, the Consultant will conduct three (3) phases.

Expert in Management of Health Information System

Academic Education:

  • At least Master’s Degree (University degree) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Management/Networks of Information of Systems, or related fields.
  • In the alternative, Bachelors level (University Degree) in these fields with at least 8 years professional working experience in health information systems in addition to the general professional experience set below.

General Professional Experience:

  • Minimum of 12 years working experience in the Information Technology field,
  • Experience in Information Systems related to the health sector, including hardware and software components;
  • Experience in developing Information System user requirements;
  • Experience in reading and interpreting Business Process Mapping and converting same to functional system requirement;
  • Experience in defining and/or setting up advanced and modern training plans / modules for managers, technicians and end-users of the system;
  • Experience in supervising and coordinating different participants / entities at the different stages of the design and implementation of IT projects.

Specific Professional Experience:

  • Minimum of 6 years working experience (not necessarily continuous) in the Health sector Extensive knowledge in designing and/or supervising IT infrastructure;
  • Good knowledge of training needs of these systems, at different user levels and over longer periods.
  • Participation in projects in developing countries;
  • Experience in the drafting of technical specifications and developing quantities and cost estimates;
  • Experience in the use of EU/EDF contracting modalities and tender templates;
  • Experience in software development for complex IT networks is an added value.
  • Experience in English speaking Caribbean countries is considered an additional advantage.

Language skills

  • The expert must be proficient in English.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3925

item.title: Expert 1
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the project:

Global objective: Review of the Financing Agreement “ The EU-South Africa Dialogue Facility CRIS number: DCI-AFS/2015/037-634” between the European Union and South Africa and financed under the Development Cooperation Instrument.

Specific objectives:

  1. Review of the project as per: relevance, effectiveness, efficiency, sustainability and impact;

  2. Revision of a sample of at least 7 specific dialogues financed by the project, with the production of at least 7 case studies describing lessons learnt and success stories (maximum 5 pages, on an appealing graphic format, with pictures and infographics are relevant) ;

  3. Analytical assessment on the current project governance structure, modus operandi, (decision making, allocation of funds, role of the PMU…) with recommendations for the second phase of the project;

  4. A cross-comparative overview of other instruments financed by the European Union, promoting policy dialogue, peer-to-peer exchanges and twinning mostly in middle and upper income countries , including of any other review already done by the EU or by any other institution/think tank on relevant instruments, with the objective to distil lessons learnt and best practice to guide the current and any future Dialogue Facility-related programmes in South Africa. The cross-comparative overview will also include a detailed literature review of the concept of “policy dialogue” as this has been/is intended by the European Union, as well as by other donors and relevant stakeholders, a historical overview on how this instrument has evolved, how it is currently implemented, as well as cross-comparison of this instrument successes and challenges in its multiple definitions and practices. The recommendation part of the report will also provide concrete insight on opportunities of twinning programmes (longer term stays of EU/MS officials in the SA administration and vice-versa) to be implemented by the current or future programmes.

Experience and qualifications required:

Education (Compulsory)

  • At least Master’s Degree Academic level in a sector related to the lot, such as governance, policy analysis, political sciences/international relations, public administration, economics or any other relevant sector.

  • No degree below Master’s will be accepted, regardless of the years of working experience.

  • A PhD level would be an added advantage.

Compulsory:

  • At least 12 year experience in the sector related to the Lot.

  • Previous experience with similar “dialogue facility” projects (and/or twinning instruments), preferably in middle-income countries.

Experience (Compulsory)

  • At least 3 experiences of conducting, as main expert (team leader or single expert), mid-term or final evaluations of project/programme financed by the European Union and any other large donor (at least one experience with the EU).

  • At least one (1) long term (18 month or more) work experience in a developing/middle income country, in close relationship with country government structures and in the international/development cooperation area.

  • Extensive knowledge of a variety of relevant EU-funded programmes, the European Commission and the European External Action Service instruments.

  • Experience with South African entities**

Preferred:

  • Previous knowledge of the Strategic Partnership between EU and one/more of the Strategic Partners, preferably from middle income countries.

  • Experience and knowledge of international cooperation between a traditional “donor” (such as the EU, the World Bank, DFID…) and middle income countries.

  • Experience in an university/think tank/policy analysis institution in matters linked to the present assignment.

  • Sound knowledge and extensive experience in the field of policy dialogue/twining.

Language skills (Compulsory)

  • Outstanding writing skills in English: analytical, concise, visually appealing and pleasant to read (one example of report to be attached to the CV).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3917

item.title: Expert 3 - Senior Legal Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the Project:

Overall objective

This objective of this assignment is to support the Government of Jamaica in developing an Integrated Financial Management Information System (IFMIS) tailored to the country needs and realities.

Specific objectives

The specific objectives of the assignment are the following:

  • To assess the current environment (“as is” state) that supports the central treasury management system (CTMS), inter alia, capacity, systems and supporting infrastructure, practices, and operations and to identify gaps, if any, with internationally accepted practices for possible improvements;

  • To re-engineer the processes of the core modules of an IFMIS (“to be” state);

  • To develop the Systems Requirement Specification (SRS) for the IFMIS, including interface/integration requirements for existing applications;

  • To develop the appropriate Business Case and project documents to guide and support the implementation of the IFMIS;

  • To develop a Request for Proposal to procure a solution based on the recommendations of the IFMIS Steering Committee.

Experience and qualifications required:

Qualifications and skills

  • At least a Master’s Degree in Law, Juridical Science or related field.

  • Alternatively, a Bachelor’s degree in Law, Juridical Science or related field with 5 years professional experience in those fields

General professional experience

  • At least 12 years of professional experience on the legal frameworks that govern the public financial management;

Specific professional experience

  • A minimum of 5 years of professional experience reviewing legislative frameworks linked to financial management systems for the public sector;

  • Proven experience with legislative frameworks based on British common-law;

  • A minimum of two (2) similar assignments in developing countries within the last 5 years.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format

External CWS using Project-Proposal US Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3916

item.title: Expert 3 – Cat II
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Description of the Project:

Objectives of the evaluation

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effects links between inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, and learning and management purposes.

The main objectives of this evaluation are to provide the relevant services of the European Union, and the interested stakeholders with:

  • An overall independent assessment of the past performance of the BEST programme, paying particular attention to its results measured against its objectives;

  • Key lessons and recommendations in order to improve future Actions.

In particular, this evaluation will serve to understand the impact generated by the Action, including unexpected added-value, if any.

The main users of this evaluation will be the EU Delegation and other stakeholders (see section 1.3) that were involved in the implementation of the Action to be evaluated.

Experience and qualifications required:

  • Six (06) years of experience in development co-operation, covering trade policy and regulatory issues and preferably with experience in international cooperation projects in developing economies in Asia;

  • Six (06) years of experience in project cycle management and at last 3 evaluations conducted for similar programmes;

  • Knowledge and professional experience of Bangladesh context in the fields relevant to these ToRs is considered an asset.

  • Bangla (at least one member of the team).

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in this role please apply via the following link to the DAI website, including your CV in EC format External CWS using Project-Proposal UK Application Form Link to job posting: https://chm.tbe.taleo.net/chm04/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=DAINC&cws=1&rid=3913

Objectives of the evaluation

Systematic and timely evaluation of its programmes and activities is an established priority of the European Commission. The focus of evaluations is on the assessment of achievements, the quality and the results of Actions in the context of an evolving cooperation policy with an increasing emphasis on result-oriented approaches. From this perspective, evaluations should look for evidence of why, whether or how these results are linked to the EU intervention and seek to identify the factors driving or hindering progress.

Evaluations should provide an understanding of the cause and effects links between inputs and activities, and outputs, outcomes and impacts. Evaluations should serve accountability, decision making, and learning and management purposes.

  • An overall independent assessment of the past performance of the BEST programme, paying particular attention to its results measured against its objectives;
